edu.ucsd.kkserver

Class KnockKnockProtocol

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucsd.kkserver.KnockKnockProtocol

  • public class KnockKnockProtocol
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines the protocol for communication between the Knock Knock Server and the Knock Knock Client. The class loads in knock knock clues and answers from the files knockknockclues.txt and knockknockanswers.txt, respectively. It searches for the files in the directory that the executable jar is from. If it can not find the files it loads a default set of KnockKnock jokes. This protocol also randomizes the jokes loaded for each client.
    Author:
    Java Tutorials, Humberto Sainz

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      KnockKnockProtocol()
      Default constructor that loads in jokes and then randomizes them.

    • Method Detail

      • processInput

        public java.lang.String processInput(java.lang.String theInput)
        Processes the input received from the input stream of the socket connection between the client and the server to progress throughout the knock knock joke. Outputs some string based on the state of the joke and whether or not the input was correct for the state at the time.
        Parameters:
        theInput - string received from input stream
        Returns:
        theOutput string to be sent to output stream
